definition: to grip forcefully/to clutch at/to guard/to control/to hold

sentences.english: Othello loves his wife Desdemona, but throttles her mercilessly.
sentences.chinese: 奧塞羅愛妻子但卻殘忍地扼死了妻子並終於自殺。

sentences.english: A murderer killed the child by choking the life out of him.
sentences.chinese: 一個殺人犯卡住這孩子的脖子把他扼死了。

sentences.english: Mett snakes, have to strangle it.
sentences.chinese: 碰到毒蛇，就得把它扼死。

sentences.english: He strangled her to death by a cord put around her neck.
sentences.chinese: 他用繩子勒住了她的脖子，將她扼死了。

sentences.english: Three of them throttled th’ victims like this.
sentences.chinese: 其中三起謀殺案的被害人都是這樣被扼死的。

definition: to hang (i.e. execute by hanging)/to strangle
to place sb on field of death/to confront with mortal danger/to give sb no way out/with one's back to the wall/looking death in the eye/part of idiom 置之死地而後生|置之死地而后生
to catch/to grapple with/to hold onto
to conspire to murder/to plot against sb's life
to nail securely/to execute by means of impalement/to crucify
